sentences: Kes valgust ei tea, see ei saa midagi teha.
context: In Estonian, 'valgust' is the partitive case form of the word 'valgus', meaning 'light'. The partitive case typically indicates incomplete action or partial object. In this context, it often appears in expressions about having light, needing light, or being affected by light. It can be used with verbs like 'saama' (to get), 'olema' (to have/be), and other related to illumination.
